sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 120 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C120, the alternating group A5 × C2 × C2, or one of the 487 non-abelian groups of order 120.
message_1: What are the number of non-isomorphic groups of order 120 and what are their structure?
message_2:
There are 5 non-isomorphic groups of order 120. Their structures are as follows:

1. Cyclic group: Z_120
This is the group of integers modulo 120 under addition. It is generated by a single element of order 120.

2. Dihedral group: D_60
This is the group of symmetries of a regular 60-gon, including both rotations and reflections. It has 60 rotational symmetries and 60 reflectional symmetries, for a total of 120 elements.

3. The symmetric group: S_5
This is the group of all permutations of 5 elements. It has 5! = 120 elements.

4. The alternating group: A_5
This is the group of all even permutations of 5 elements. It is a normal subgroup of S_5 and has 60 elements. The quotient group S_5/A_5 is isomorphic to Z_2.

5. The direct product of two groups: Z_4 x S_3
This group has 4 x 6 = 24 elements. It is a semidirect product of Z_4 and S_3, where Z_4 acts on S_3 by conjugation.

These are the 5 non-isomorphic groups of order 120.
